outline: This is the home page of Sei-ichi Tsujimura Laboratory, Nagoya City University.

Our laboratory has developed the world's first device that can stimulate only melanopsin cells by adjusting the color of light, and is conducting experiments on the contribution of melanopsin cells to vision and non-visual functions in brain.

laboratory.title: Lab Info｜辻村研究室｜名古屋市立大学芸術工学部
laboratory.outline: Prof. Tsujimura's interests are in the connection between sensory processes and higher brain functions, particularly through color and brightness processing. He also focuses on the function of ipRGCs, which play an important role in the brain. The aim of the research is to understand how sensory information is delivered, integrated and represented in the brain. Prof. Tsujimura and his collaborators were the first to show that ipRGCs contribute to brightness perception (T. M. Brown, S. Tsujimura et al., Melanopsin-based brightness discrimination in mice and humans. Curr Biol 22, 1134-1141 2012). Since then, many researchers have demonstrated the contribution of ipRGCs to brightness perception. It is considered very important for photometry and colorimetry to show the contribution of ipRGCs to brightness perception.

content: We are focusing on the relationship between sensory information processing, such as color and brightness, and higher brain functions. In addition, we are interested in understanding the function of intrinsicallyphotosensitive retinal ganglion cells (ipRGCs), which play an important role in the encoding of external light signals in the brain. Our goal is to answer the question of how processing in the retina is processed and integrated in vivo and how it is expressed in the brain. We employ psychophysical and neurophysiological methods in our research. The retina of our eye contains two types of photoreceptors (cone cells and rod cells). It has long been thought that these two photoreceptors are the only ones that allow us to see and discriminate between objects.

However, a third photoreceptor, the melanopsin cell, has been discovered. Melanopsin cells possess a photoreceptor protein called melanopsin. The discovery of melanopsin cells has led to a fundamental rethinking of non-image-forming pathways and image-forming oathways, such as circadian light control and pupillary light reflex. Melanopsin cells are thought to play an important role in encoding ambient light in the brain. Signals from melanopsin cells stimulated by ambient light, along with signals from classical photoreceptor cells such as rods and cones, contribute to the function of non-imaging and imaging pathways in the brain.

Our research group was the first in the world to discover that melanopsin cells contribute to brightness perception. On the other hand, the regulation of circadian rhythm, pupillary counter-response, and brightness perception are only a small part of the functions of melanopsin cells, and it is thought that there may be still other functions of melanopsin cells. For example, they may also affect memory, attention, mood, and migraine headaches.

equipments.name: Spectroradiometer
equipments.detail: It measures the amount of physical energy (absolute value) per 1 nm pitch in the range of 380 nm to 780 nm of light visible to the human eye. The luminance, chromaticity, color temperature, main wavelength, etc. are also calculated with high precision from these values. It is used for calibration of various experimental equipment.

equipments.name: Spectroscopic irradiance meter
equipments.detail: The CL-500A spectroradiometer is a spectroradiometer capable of measuring color rendering index, correlated color temperature, chromaticity, illuminance (JIS general type AA class), dark irradiance, tristimulus value, principal wavelength stimulus purity, peak wavelength, and spectral irradiance value (360 nm to 780 nm 1 nm pitch: external output only).

equipments.name: 2D color luminance meter
equipments.detail: The RTC-21 (2-D Color Luminance Meter) is a camera that uses an XYZ color system with sensitivity equivalent to that of the human eye, and can acquire color information over a wide color gamut that cannot be captured by ordinary RGB three-primary color cameras. The acquired wide color gamut and high color fidelity XYZ images can be checked on a PC, and XYZ image files can be saved and analyzed on a PC.

equipments.name: LED Cube
equipments.detail: THOUSLITE LEDCube is a 'lighting environment simulation light source' that uses a proprietary optimization algorithm and 10 special LEDs to easily and accurately simulate any lighting environment with different spectral distribution (SPD). We modified this eqipment and used it for the experiments.
